* The investment is driven by evidence and aims to support international best practices in driving up standards.

• Phoebe, Piper, and Prue are at a bar when they notice a man sitting alone.
• Prue suspects that her sister, Phoebe, has been preoccupied with a man, Cole, and suggests that she should focus on herself.
• Meanwhile, Prue is also dealing with her own issues, as she believes that the triad, a powerful demonic force, is after her.
• Back at the bar, Piper offers to get Sean another drink, even though it is against the club's limit.
• Prue excuses herself to go to the bathroom, where she is attacked by an unknown assailant.
• The attacker is revealed to be a woman named Abbey, who has been stalking Prue and is obsessed with her life.
• Abbey ties Prue up in the basement and plans to take over her identity.
• Prue's sisters, Phoebe and Piper, become worried when they can't reach her and go to the bar to look for her.
• With the help of Darryl, a police officer, they discover that Abbey is the one who attacked Prue and go to the manor to save her.

• In the scene, Booth, Brennan, and Sweets are at Sweets' office for a therapy session. Booth and Brennan are reluctant to participate, but Sweets insists that it is important for their partnership.
• Sweets tries to get Booth and Brennan to open up about their feelings and work together, but Booth is skeptical and Brennan is dismissive. The tension between them is palpable.
• The scene shifts to the FBI headquarters, where Booth and Brennan are discussing the case of a murdered man found on an abandoned VA hospital property.
• They are joined by Cam, who informs them that the body was cooked before it was dumped. Hodgins suggests that it may be related to a previous case involving cannibalism.
• The team begins to investigate the murder, interviewing suspects and gathering evidence. Booth and Brennan have different approaches to the case, with Booth focusing on the victim's personal life and Brennan focusing on the scientific evidence.
• As they get closer to solving the case, they discover a web of deceit and betrayal involving the victim's family and business associates. Ultimately, they are able to identify the killer and bring them to justice.

* In Berlin, two CIA agents are abducted and a building explosion kills one of them, Peter Klein. The Covenant claims responsibility and demands the release of Sark in exchange for the remaining agent, Rotter.
* The CIA learns that Sark may be responsible for the death of a high-ranking Covenant member and they approve the trade to avoid revenge attacks. Sydney insists on going to Munich to retrieve the package left by the Covenant, but Dixon prefers to send Weiss instead.
* In Mexico, Sydney successfully retrieves Rotter, but Sark escapes with the Covenant. Lindsay, the NSC Director, ambushes the exchange operation, causing chaos and endangering the last hostage.
* Sydney confronts Lindsay about his actions, and he threatens to have her arrested. She stands her ground and challenges his abuse of power.
* In Frankfurt, Sydney infiltrates a nightclub known to be a Covenant front and meets Otto Edel, the club owner. She proposes making his drug more addictive to increase sales, in exchange for a liter of his product.
* Sydney manages to incapacitate Edel and force him to reveal the location of the alarm terminal that protects the sub-basement. She disables the alarm, allowing Weiss' team to proceed inside and rescue the last hostage.

• Frasier expresses his feelings for Kate, but she is leaving for Chicago and reveals she has a new job there. Frasier rushes to her apartment to stop her from leaving, but finds out she already has a new boyfriend.
• Frasier's date, Donna, comes over to watch movies with him and his family, but he leaves to stop Kate from getting on her plane. Kate's flight is delayed, and they reunite at the airport, but Kate has to leave for a board meeting the next day.
• Frasier picks up Kate's cat, Louie, as he leaves the airport, and Niles spills his drink while trying not to wake Daphne, who is asleep on his shoulder.

* Lorelai tells Emily about her engagement to Max, but Emily dismisses it, causing Lorelai to confront her about her lack of enthusiasm and emotional distance.
* Sookie throws Lorelai an engagement party, but Emily doesn't attend due to a prior commitment. Lorelai is touched by the town's support and the effort Sookie put into the party.
* Lorelai visits Emily again to ask her opinion on wedding veils, and Emily suggests a tiara instead. Lorelai is surprised but takes it as a small step towards a better relationship with her mother.

• Ty takes a job at a game reserve to guarantee his stay after Scott couldn't; he encounters poachers and captures one of them.
• Amy helps a skittish horse, Dash, and discovers that he has trouble standing still. Jade, who is staying at Heartland, is assigned as a ranch hand and initially shows reluctance towards horses.

• In the underworld, Cole confronts the Seer about becoming the Source. The Seer reveals that Kurzon, another demon, will attempt to take over the underworld.
• In the manor, Paige reveals to Piper that she has been promoted to social worker. Later, Phoebe expresses her fears about marrying Cole to Piper.
• Phoebe experiences a premonition about Cole, but Piper dismisses it as cold feet. Meanwhile, Cole visits the Seer in the underworld.
• The Seer tells Cole that he must work with the Charmed Ones to defeat Kurzon, who is threatening to take over the underworld.
• At work, Paige is promoted to social worker, but she feels guilty about using magic for personal gain.
• Phoebe casts a spell to determine if she should marry Cole, which accidentally brings her past and future selves to the present.
• Old Phoebe, Phoebe's future self, reveals that she and Cole did not get married, and she urges Phoebe to be cautious about changing the future.
• Kurzon attacks the manor, targeting little Phoebe, who is Phoebe's past self. Cole is able to save her, and the Charmed Ones vanquish Kurzon.

• Terri, a high school student, feels insecure about her weight and believes that guys do not notice her.
• She is approached by Spinner, who asks for her notes for a class he missed. He also asks her if she is going to the school dance, but Terri reveals that her father is making her do chores instead.
• Ashley, Terri's friend, encourages her to go to the dance and even offers to help her get ready. However, Terri is still unsure and feels nervous about her appearance.
• With the help of Ashley and Paige, Terri gets ready for the dance and feels more confident about herself. She and Paige head to the dance, but Terri becomes drunk along the way.
• At the dance, Terri is drunk and makes a scene, causing Ashley to intervene. Spinner asks Terri to dance, but she becomes sick and runs to the bathroom.
• The next day at school, Terri is embarrassed about what happened at the dance. She is approached by Spinner, who returns her notes and thanks her for lending them to him.
• Paige tells Terri that she will be using Spinner's notes from now on, leaving Terri feeling sad and left out. Ashley looks on sympathetically, and the scene ends with a close-up of Terri's face.

• Rachel and Ross enter Monica and Rachel's apartment, revealing that Ross never got an annulment after their drunken Las Vegas wedding.
• Rachel is upset and yells at Ross, while the rest of the gang is shocked by the news.
• Meanwhile, at Central Perk, Joey finds a pair of keys to a Porsche and assumes they belong to Gunther.
• Phoebe asks Monica and Chandler to babysit Frank and Alice's triplets, but it turns out they are not actually puppies.
• Rachel and Phoebe discuss living together now that Denise is leaving town, and Rachel suggests she could be Phoebe's roommate.
• Ross tries to make amends with Rachel by getting a court date for their annulment, but things quickly escalate when Rachel accuses him of having three failed marriages.
• The next day, Monica, Chandler, and Phoebe struggle to change the triplets' diapers and come up with a system to make it easier.
• Joey borrows cleaning supplies from Monica to wash the Porsche he found, but it turns out to be someone else's car.
• At the courthouse, Rachel and Ross's attempt at an annulment is unsuccessful, and they are told they will have to file for divorce instead.
• Back at Monica's apartment, Chandler has swallowed a small part from one of Joey's toys and the gang rushes him to the hospital.

* A man is talking about the importance of forgiveness in life.
* George is trying to find Izzie, while Meredith is dealing with her own problems at the hospital.
* Cristina and Derek are working on a patient with a spinal injury, while Izzie is dealing with the aftermath of her actions with George.
* Meredith is having issues with her new intern, Norman, and is trying to fix a mistake he made.
* Callie is dealing with a patient who has a severe case of osteoporosis and is trying to convince Bailey to operate on her.
* George finally finds Izzie and they talk about their situation, while Meredith is still dealing with the fallout of Norman's mistake.
* The man's voiceover talks about the importance of forgiveness and moving on from past wrongs.

* The episode originally featured a subplot about Daphne trying to expand her physical therapy clientele, but it was later cut.
* Frasier, Niles, and Martin discuss an invitation to La Porte d'Argent, an exclusive place with an upscale clientele. Frasier and Niles are intrigued and decide to visit, but are initially denied entry because they are not on the list.
* Frasier and Niles visit La Porte d'Argent and are thrilled to discover that it is a luxurious day spa. They enjoy various treatments and decide to make it a standing appointment. However, they are disappointed to learn that they can only access the silver level, and not the more exclusive gold level.
* Martin and Daphne watch an episode of The Rockford Files, and Daphne comments that Martin reminds her of Rockford's dad. Martin is offended and turns off the TV.
* Frasier and Niles are still fixated on gaining access to the gold level at La Porte d'Argent. They comb through their Rolodexes to see if they know anyone who can help them.
* Roz offers to help Frasier and Niles by calling Senator Ogden, whom she knows from a past relationship. She agrees to help them get into the gold level, but only if they promise to stop obsessing over it.

<summary>

* Ted, the narrator, tells his kids about a shirt that changed his life and starts the story in 2005.
* At a bar, Ted's friends comment on his newfound liking for bourbon and an old shirt, leading him to consider revisiting past relationships.
* The group discusses Ted's ex-girlfriends, and he contemplates calling Natalie, with whom he has fond memories.
* Barney advises against it, claiming that Ted dumped a porn star, while Ted insists it wasn't like that.
* Robin receives a promotion at work, and Natalie, after initially hanging up on Ted, agrees to meet him to talk.
* Ted apologizes to Natalie for breaking up with her over her answering machine on her birthday and tries to explain his feelings.
* Natalie, upset, ends the relationship, and Ted faces the consequences of his actions, learning that there is no "good" way to break up with someone.

</summary>

• Sheldon is upset about a misleading wallet description on walletnook.com.
• Raj's parents, Dr. and Mrs. Koothrappali, video chat with their son and meet Leonard, Sheldon, and Howard.
• Dr. Koothrappali asks about their academic careers and their parents' opinions on their limited earning potential.
• Raj's parents reveal they have given Lalita Gupta, Raj's childhood bully, his contact information for a potential arranged marriage.
• Sheldon explains the cultural context of arranged marriages in India, comparing it to the storyline in Fiddler on the Roof.
• Raj is hesitant about the arranged marriage and considers finding new friends.
• Later, Raj asks Howard to help him call Lalita, and Howard pretends to be Raj during the call.
• In the end, Raj decides to meet Lalita and invites her to Penny's restaurant, where they can get to know each other.

• Sheldon is drawing a hypothetical containment field for a wormhole.
• Howard jokes about Sheldon's daily disappearance, which lasts for twenty minutes and is unaccounted for.
• Leonard, Howard, and Raj suspect that Sheldon is hiding something and decide to follow him.
• They discover that Sheldon goes to a storage room in the basement every day.
• Leonard is jealous of Penny's new friend, who is a handsome English guy.
• Penny reassures Leonard that they are just friends, but Leonard remains skeptical.
• Sheldon and Leonard suspect that Penny's friend might be hitting on her.
• Howard and Raj try to figure out the meaning of the number "43" that Sheldon always says before entering the storage room.
• Sheldon reveals that he uses the room to recharge and that the number "43" is a secret.
• Sheldon is seen playing keepie-uppie with a beanbag in the storage room.

* Casey and Ashleigh are hosting a slumber party for their sorority sisters at ZBZ house. Casey has a campaign event planned to impress the girls and become the next Zeta Beta President. Rebecca is skeptical of the bonding activities and suspects Casey's true motive is to win their votes.
* Meanwhile, at KT house, Cappie is trying to impress a girl named Destiny who showed up with a flat tire. Rusty becomes suspicious of Destiny's true intentions and finds out she has been lying about her identity. Destiny confesses to Rusty that she had a crush on Cappie since they were kids and has been trying to get his attention for the past ten years.
* At Omega Chi house, Evan and Calvin are left behind to take care of the house during the game. They watch a horror movie and Calvin gets a text from his little brother, Heath, who is also watching the same movie. A news report comes on about an escaped mental patient from Stonybrook Mental Institution who is considered unstable and extremely dangerous.
* Back at ZBZ house, the girls are trying to communicate with the ghost of Virginia Horton through a séance. Rebecca accuses Casey of sabotaging the event to get more votes. Suddenly, the wind picks up, a loose brick falls, and a note appears with votes for Virginia. The girls realize that Virginia actually won the election, but someone had fixed the results.

* Veronica and Keith discuss the unsolved case of Dean O'Dell's death and the possibility of it being a murder.
* Weevil provides information about the night of the dean's death, and Keith finds a bottle of whiskey in the dean's office.
* Veronica helps Mac and her friends find their stolen research monkey and twenty rats taken by an animal rights group.
* Veronica and Mac attend a PHAT meeting and learn about the group's letter-writing campaign to raise awareness about animal cruelty.
* Veronica suspects Darla, a PHAT member, of being involved in the theft and sets up a plan to gain her trust.
* Keith and Landry bond over drinks and share stories about their past relationships with women.

* J.R. and Amanda are sharing a room together, and Amanda is pregnant with J.R.'s child. Tad advises J.R. to take things slow and not rush into a family with Amanda.
* Reese and Bianca have decided to stay in Pine Valley instead of moving to France. Greenlee is unable to attend the wedding due to food poisoning.
* Annie has taken Aidan's gun and is holding Ryan at gunpoint, preventing him from marrying Greenlee. Kendall is upset after overhearing that Reese and Bianca are staying in Pine Valley.

• Dr. Sinclair keeps her promise to declare Annie fit to stand trial for Richie's murder.
• Greenlee is still missing, and Ryan is determined to find her despite the dangerous weather conditions.
• Jake tries to convince Zach to rest, but Kendall refuses to see him.
• Bianca confronts Reese about Greenlee's disappearance and Zach's infidelity.
• Krystal talks to J.R. about his relationship with Amanda and his feelings for Babe.
• David threatens Amanda, warning her to get him access to Little A or face consequences.

• J.R. is considering his father's offer of 50 million dollars to reconcile, but Tad advises him to define his own goals and not be influenced by Adam's manipulations.
• Babe is torn between her feelings for J.R. and her attraction to Richie Novak, who has been informed that he may be eligible for a bone marrow transplant.
• Colby discovers that Dre is the son of Senator Samuel Woods and is hiding from his father's political ambitions and expectations.
• Hannah takes Josh hostage and shoots at Zach, who then pursues her. Sean gets caught in the middle of the chase and is accidentally kissed by Hannah.
• Kendall and Zach discuss Hannah's threat to their family, and Zach orders his men to take her down if necessary, causing tension between them.

<summary>

- In the Salvatore boarding house, Damon struggles to write Liz's eulogy while Caroline sleeps among her friends.
- Damon tells Caroline that today isn't the worst day of her life, hinting at the quiet days to come.
- Caroline rallies her friends to complete five days' worth of projects for Liz's funeral in one day.
- In a 1994 prison world, Bonnie has regained her magic and plans to return home when the eclipse occurs.
- Jo is suffering from food poisoning, but Kai, who has merged with Luke, believes it's due to a failed merge with Jo.
- Kai reveals that if he dies, the prison worlds, including the one Bonnie is in, will collapse.
- Stefan asks Damon for advice on how to approach Caroline after their kiss, and Damon suggests letting her have today for her mother's funeral.
- At Liz's funeral, Damon delivers the eulogy, telling Caroline how proud her mother was of her.
- Caroline delivers a heartfelt speech at the funeral, and later, Tyler and Matt discuss their future plans, while Elena worries about Caroline being alone.

</summary>

* Simone and Joni are caught trying to break into a school to get publicity for Fusion. Mia confronts Alison about Jake leaving her for Alison. Liza tells Adam she kissed Tad.
* Lysistrata and Tad have a therapy session that turns into a date. Jamie and Adam argue about JR's disappearance, with Adam accusing Jamie of hiding JR due to jealousy. Doug and Laurie argue about Laurie's desire to go to college.
* Erica defends Chris to Jack, who warns her that Chris is not the man she thinks he is. Chris and Michael discuss Erica's fidelity. Reggie walks in on Chris and Erica about to have sex. Greenlee fires Simone from Fusion.

* Tad and Jake discuss a dating website, with Tad teasing Jake about his potential matches.
* Amanda reveals to J.R. that she couldn't go through with helping him ruin Erica's company, and she gave back the money.
* Erica threatens to have Adam arrested for his criminal actions, but Adam dares her to do so.
* J.R. presents Amanda with a legal agreement for primary custody and child support of their unborn child.
* Jake and Tad discuss a woman from the dating website, with Jake expressing his bitterness towards his ex-girlfriend.
* Amanda and J.R. argue over custody of their unborn child, with Amanda refusing to sign over custody.
* David and Krystal discuss getting married, with Krystal expressing her doubts about the empty house and David reassuring her.
* Amanda and Jake discuss her job loss and her plans for the future, with Jake offering her a place to stay.

• Sheldon Cooper and Amy Farrah Fowler are hosting the final episode of their Internet show, Fun with Flags.
• Sheldon explains that he can no longer balance his career, the show, and his girlfriend, Amy.
• Meanwhile, Leonard, Howard, and Raj are cleaning out the office of a deceased professor and discover his food diary, which is full of numbers.
• They initially think it might be related to his research, but it turns out to be a record of his calorie intake.
• At a sales conference, Penny's coworker Dan makes a comment about Bernadette's intensity, which Penny defends.
• Later, Bernadette apologizes to Dan for being rude about his grandson, and he reveals that the company stopped paying for their coffee five months ago.
• Everyone has been putting money in a swear jar to pay for Bernadette's private bathroom, which was supposed to be for the whole floor.
• Bernadette feels guilty and decides to be more sensitive in the future.
• Back at the apartment, Sheldon is upset that no one has commented on the final episode of Fun with Flags.
• Leonard commiserates, saying that he spent the day throwing out a dead professor's career.
• Sheldon receives a comment on the final episode and decides to bring back the show.
• Leonard is unsure about the decision, but Sheldon ignores him and pops a bottle of champagne to celebrate.
• Sheldon then visits LeVar Burton to ask him to be in the next episode, where they will discuss German flags.
• LeVar is uninterested and tells Sheldon to get a gate, but Sheldon persists and suggests that LeVar dress up like a swastika.

• Angie is concerned about Krystal's relationship with David and thinks she is being manipulated.
• Tad also notices a change in Krystal and believes there is something else going on besides David's influence.
• Krystal is worried about Little A's safety and wants to keep him away from J.R. and Adam.
• David is determined to get custody of Little A and is not afraid to threaten Jesse to make it happen.
• J.R. is in jail and Colby is worried about the consequences of her actions.
• J.R. reveals to Colby that there is something she doesn't know about their father.
• Zach and Kendall's marriage is on the rocks, and Erica tries to convince them to fight for their love.
• Ryan is struggling with his feelings for Greenlee and Kendall, and Emma is a constant reminder of his loss.
• Opal is having trouble sleeping and feels that Greenlee's soul needs to be set free.
• Jack and Ryan make arrangements for Greenlee's ashes to be scattered in a meaningful location.

• Jamie is arrested for being involved with a drug dealer, Seth Phelps, whom J.R. also knows from high school.
• Babe confronts J.R. about his relationship with Seth and suspects Jamie of using drugs. J.R. reveals that Seth may have drugged Babe out of revenge.
• Danielle gets arrested for being involved with Reggie's drug bust, leading to a confrontation between Derek and Jack.
• Krystal agrees to help David be a real father to Babe, but David struggles to connect with his daughter.
• Ryan warns Kendall not to harm Greenlee, Jonathan, or anyone he cares about, or she will face consequences.

• Annie has been remembering more things and claims that Tori, a person who only Annie can see, has been helping her.
• Adam, who is supposed to be in the hospital, shows up at Erica's place and they kiss.
• The police are looking for Adam and Erica tells him that he needs to go back to the hospital.
• J.R., Colby, and Tad discuss the abandoned car found in Pine Valley that belongs to Adam.
• Reese visits the hospital to check on Ian and gets into an argument with Kendall.
• Zach prays for Ian's health and asks Myrtle for help.
• David operates on a child and struggles with his emotions due to the similarity with his daughter's age.

• Taylor is at the hospital to have her foot checked out at the insistence of her friend, Dr. Franklin Hubbard.
• J.R. is trying to help Babe take over Fusion, as he believes she would be a better leader than Kendall and Greenlee.
• Fletcher, a pimp, is threatening Randi, a Fusion employee, into paying him off or he will reveal her past as a sex worker.
• Krystal warns J.R. against acting like his father, Adam, in his attempts to acquire Fusion.
• Annie quits Fusion after a heated argument with Kendall and Greenlee.
• Kendall reveals to Greenlee that she found a hidden key in Annie's picture frame and made a copy of it, as she believes Annie is hiding something.

* A shooting occurs at Angie and Jesse's wedding, leaving several people injured, including Julia Keefer. Tad is critically wounded and taken to the hospital.
* Robert, Tad's uncle and a retired FBI agent, is revealed to be the shooter. He takes Angie hostage and holds her at gunpoint on the roof of the casino. Frankie, Jake, and Jesse pursue him.
* Julia's condition worsens, and she decides against having surgery. She knows that she will die regardless and asks Krystal to call her sister in California and tell Kathy that she loves her.
* Greenlee struggles to come to terms with Aidan's betrayal and enlists Zach's help in removing her engagement ring. Ryan agrees to find Greenlee and help her understand the situation, despite his own complicated history with her.

• Ryan and Annie discuss the state of their marriage, with Ryan asking for more time to figure things out.
• Greenlee asks Zach for help in winning back Aidan, her true love.
• Jack visits Erica in prison and discusses the progress of Carmen's case.
• Tad and Krystal celebrate Jenny's birthday, reflecting on the past year and their gratitude for their family.
• Angie and Jesse share a romantic moment, with Angie dreaming about their honeymoon.
• Erica, Jack, and Carmen discuss Carmen's legal situation and the challenges she faces in the criminal justice system.
• Greenlee and Zach argue about her relationship with Aidan, with Zach questioning her true feelings.
• Ryan and Annie continue their conversation, with Ryan expressing his regret for his past mistakes.
• Erica reflects on her connections and privilege, and Carmen shares her experiences with the criminal justice system.
• Jesse shares stories about Jenny and her impact on his life, emphasizing the importance of love and friendship.

• Annie is excited about planning her wedding and suggests getting married at the Empire State Building or a local club.
• Scott is open to the ideas and wants to make sure Annie knows she is the only thing that matters to him.
• J.R. is working on a business deal and tells his associate to keep it a secret from his uncle, Scott.
• Annie considers eloping to Vegas after her divorce is finalized, but Scott thinks it might cut down their guest list significantly.
• Marissa is upset after failing the bar exam and confides in Caleb, who encourages her to keep trying.
• Emma is wishing for a new Cinderella dress after losing the one Greenlee gave her, and Ryan is unsure how to help.
• Greenlee is carrying a picture of her and Ryan, which David finds and questions her about.
• Greenlee explains that the picture was given to her by her father and she has no sentimental attachment to it.
• David apologizes for accusing her and tells her he trusts her, then leaves for a meeting.

• Erica is being held prisoner and pleads with her captor to let her keep photographs of her fiancé and daughter.
• Liza is presented with a forensics report on Diana Holden's murder and is urged to read between the lines and consider the possibility that the wrong person is being accused.
• Cara begs Jake to let her go to her brother, who is in danger, but Jake insists on keeping her safe.
• Kendall holds Ricky at gunpoint and demands to know where Bianca is, while Ricky tries to convince her that he did everything for her and their future together.
• Jack assures Bianca that they will find Kendall and that Ricky will be punished, while Bianca wonders where her mother is.
• Jane avoids being in Bianca's hospital room due to painful memories and expresses a desire to return to having fun with Jack.
• Marissa and Bianca bond over their shared experience of being held captive by Ricky and work together to escape, while J.R. offers them comfort and support.

• Angie and Jesse are excited about their honeymoon suite, but it turns out to be next to a real wedding.
• Jack and Zach are trying to find Erica, who is with Carmen, and suspect they are planning something.
• Erica, Carmen, Louisa, and Mando are discussing a bank robbery that Mando committed, and Erica is trying to get him to confess.
• Angie and Jesse are joking around in their hotel room when a fire alarm goes off, interrupting their moment.
• Jack and Zach are discussing the stakeout they had on Armando's mother's apartment, and how Erica and Carmen might be in trouble if they go there.
• Louisa agrees to participate in Erica's reality show, which will focus on her life as a single mother.
• Aidan is feeling guilty about his behavior towards Kendall and Annie, and Kendall reassures him that everything will be okay.
• Annie is signing divorce papers, but her lawyer, Livia, is trying to convince her to reconsider.
• Greenlee is leaving Ryan to go back to Aidan, but Ryan is encouraging her to stay.
• Angie and Jesse are leaving their hotel room, joking around and happy about their night together.

• Damon comforts Colby after a sleepless night due to witnessing a murder.
• A.J. asks about his grandfather's death and is reassured by Marissa and Krystal.
• Asher's job application at Chandler Enterprises is questioned due to false education history.
• Kendall is worried about Ryan's arrest and her own legal issues.
• Greenlee takes responsibility for her actions and decides to come clean about her involvement in David's crimes.
• J.R. and Marissa argue about how to handle A.J.'s grief over David's death.

• J.R. and Babe visit a bank to access Dixie's account information, hoping it will provide clues to her whereabouts.
• Alfred, the bank manager, is initially uncooperative, but Babe's persuasive skills lead him to reveal the information.
• Meanwhile, Tad and Aidan investigate Dixie's connection to Garret Williams, a man seen speaking with Dixie before Julia's disappearance.
• Julia, held captive with Di, plans to kill Garret when he returns, but Di hesitates to participate in a murder.
• Greenlee discusses her grief over Ryan's death with Erin, expressing her belief that she will never love again.

• Erica suspects that Dr. Greg Madden, the fertility specialist who helped Kendall carry Greenlee's baby, has a grudge against her and her family.
• Jack and Erica vow to work together to figure out what happened and to support Kendall through the difficult times ahead.
• Greenlee is devastated and drives away alone, while Ryan and Kendall are left to deal with the aftermath of their actions.
• Zach confesses his love for Kendall, who is comforted by him in her condo.

• Erica and Ethan argue over Kendall, with Erica refusing to give her blessing for their marriage and Ethan threatening to reveal Erica's lack of support for their relationship.
• Jack, Reggie, and Lily discuss the investigation into Edmund's murder, with Lily insisting that Braden, not Zach, is the killer.
• Kendall confronts Lily about her claims, causing Reggie to defend his sister and leading to a heated argument between Kendall and Reggie.
• Erica and Jack discuss the situation, with Jack expressing concern for Ryan, Greenlee, and Lily's safety due to Braden still being at large.
• Kendall, feeling unsupported by her family, declares her independence and storms out.
• Ethan calls Arthur to discuss Erica, while Zach calls Livia to discuss his case and Lily's testimony.
• The episode ends with a preview for the next episode, featuring David, Jack, Ethan, Kendall, and Erica.
<summary>
• Erica and Ethan argue over Kendall's hand in marriage.
• Jack, Reggie, and Lily discuss the investigation into Edmund's murder.
• Kendall confronts Lily about her claims, causing a heated argument.
• Erica and Jack discuss the situation, with Jack expressing concern for Ryan, Greenlee, and Lily's safety.
• Kendall declares her independence and storms out.
• Ethan calls Arthur to discuss Erica, while Zach calls Livia to discuss his case.
• The episode ends with a preview for the next episode.
</summary>

• Jamie and Amanda are at the top of a mountain, but their romantic moment is interrupted by Babe's arrival.
• Tad is trying to get information from Dixie about Kevin Sturgess, who he believes is involved in criminal activities and is a threat to Julia Santos.
• Julia is talking to Sam, who is living with the Martins while Maria and Maddie are in California. Julia tells Sam about how she and Noah fell in love and how she knows that biological parents can't be replaced.
• Mimi is determined to find Julia Santos and is questioning Zach about his involvement in her disappearance.
• Greenlee is convinced that Ryan is alive and is struggling with the idea of having a baby without him.
• Tad and Dixie are discussing the situation with Kevin Sturgess and Dixie's past with him.
• Erin is taking Jonathan to the hospital and Ryan is going with them to help with the cover-up of his identity.

• Casey Hughes expresses his nervousness about getting married to Alison Stewart, as he wants their marriage to be as strong as his parents' or Bob and Kim's.
• Mick Dante, who claims to be the reincarnated James Stenbeck, reveals to Alison that he was brainwashed by Stenbeck using a device that implanted thoughts in his mind.
• Emily Stewart confronts Paul Ryan about his plan to kill Mick Dante, warning him that he will end up in jail and ruin his own life.

• Erica is upset about being charged with insider trading due to a tip from Adam. She accuses him of not being a true friend and sweeping it under the rug. Adam apologizes, but Erica is not satisfied and tells him that she is glad he turned his back on her because it made her do the right thing.

• Adam tells Erica that Tad's daughter, Kate, is not missing anymore because he found her. Erica is surprised and asks how long Adam deliberately kept Tad from his own daughter. Adam explains that Tad kept him from his daughter forever and impregnated his wife, so he saw it as a form of payback.

• Krystal is looking for Adam to tell him that Tad wants to talk to him. She reflects on how she took Tad for granted and thought he would always be there for her and Jenny. Babe asks how they got to this point, and Krystal warns her not to say anything bad about Adam, even though she understands why he did what he did.

* The group has gathered to honor Katherine Chancellor, who left instructions for them from beyond the grave. They are to write letters to Katherine, expressing their thoughts and feelings, and then burn the letters to release the smoke to her.
* Many of those present write heartfelt letters, sharing their hopes, dreams, and fears. Jill, however, refuses to write a letter, still upset about not receiving the music box she believes Katherine promised her.
* After everyone has written their letters, they gather around a bowl and light the letters on fire, releasing the smoke to Katherine. Murphy thanks everyone for coming and encourages them to have a party, as Katherine wanted.
* As the group mingles and begins to dance, Jill has a moment of realization. She thanks Katherine for sending her on a journey and for ultimately leading her back to Colin, who has changed her life. She no longer needs the music box and decides to give it back to Katherine, hoping that she is having the time of her life on her current journey.
